result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle L. Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days.
Provide DNA sample if not done so already.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kyle L. Hill in court with attorney Jared Redfield. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-55 and 15CF-150.

9:33 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.

Defendant will plead to 15CF-55. Defendant will plead to the single count. 
15CF-150 will be dismissed and read in.

Defense is free to argue.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

Victim is present and would like to make a statement.

Atty Redfield concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Atty Knaapen clarifies that it is the victim's mother who would like to make a statement.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1, 15CF-55.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Redfield for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-55: Child Abuse
15CF-150: Dismissed and Read In

Parties are prepared to go to sentencing today.

9:41 AM Debra Edman addresses the Court.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court, Defendant rejected probation. Atty Knaapen reviews previous convictions.
Atty Redfield makes sentencing arguments to the Court, recommends jail sentence of 3 months and home monitor.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court believes plea agreement is fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-55:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for a period of 6 Months
0 Days Jail Credit
May serve last half of sentence on electronic monitor program if Defendant qualifies
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days
Pay costs
60 days to pay the costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Provide DNA sample if not done so already

Bond amended No unsupervised or abusive contact with CLE, Deborah Erdmann or their residences. 
No contact with Christine Mills.

3:30 p.m. Defendant Kyle L. Hill in court with attorney Jared Redfield. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Kyle L. Hill
Current: 3357 Mission Lane, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 04-10-2015)
Prior: 3357 Mission Lane, Plover, WI 54467
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

No contact with CLE, Deborah Erdmann or their residences. 
No contact with Christine Mills.

Defendant Kyle L. Hill in court with attorney Jared Redfield. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Atty Knaapen recommends a $10,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Redfield makes bond arguments to the Court.  Request no abusive contact with the parties. 
Atty Knaapen makes additional arguments to the Court. 
Atty Redfield makes additional arguments to the Court.

BY THE COURT:  Bond is set.  Court indicates he may reconsider if he gets written consent from HHS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
